alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued November 08 at 5:41AM EST until November 12 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.0 to 7.2 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 9 AM EST this morning. For the High Surf Advisory, from noon today to 6 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Significant saltwater inundation will render numerous roads impassable. Properties may also flood. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 7:31 AM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Significant beach erosion is likely, especially around times of high tide this week. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 08/08 AM 7.1 1.3 0.6 N/A Minor 08/08 PM 7.3 1.5 1.7 N/A Minor 09/08 AM 7.9 2.1 1.4 N/A Moderate 09/08 PM 7.7 1.9 2.4 N/A Moderate 10/09 AM 8.4 2.6 2.1 N/A Major 10/09 PM 6.4 0.6 1.3 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
